Reviews.Title: “Terrable place! Run away fast”
Reviews.Author: rat2828
Reviews.Content: I tried to used my rewards card to get a room here for 2 nights, I got here and they first thing is they wanted money just to park my car, no other respectable place here wanted parking fees. When I made ther reservation It also said it had a hot tub which was the reason I decided on this place, but no, it was out of order. The room was drab, the condition of the hotel was poor and the Choice Hotels said they could not refund my points for the second night. Thanks Choice for a not so good 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “not family firendly location”
Reviews.Author: wallers3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in bad repair, not continental breakfast as advertised and the restaurant on premise does not have kid friendly options, and increases prices for quests. The pool is in poor repair , the tables and loughe chairs are coated with polution, car exhaust the towels were black before we could use them. manager unwilling to change or compensate for loud rattling air conditioning, restaurant vouchers or the damage to our towels and clothing from poolside filth.

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of it all.”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoRic
Reviews.Content: We could only stay one night in this up-scale Quality Inn. It is close to it all. A short cab ride from the Airport. (less than $10) Within a short bus ride to Old Town and connections to the San Diego Trolley and the international border. And all sorts of shopping tourist activities. Who needs a car? The room was very clean and quiet. The hosts were helpful and we enjoyed chatting with them. This property is a six story building with wide well lit hallways and two elevators. It seemed that the elevator was always there within a minuet or two. Because we had our car with us we were glad to see that they off street underground parking that was secure.

Reviews.Title: “Very uncomfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: Robyn3
Reviews.Content: Pretty mediocre hotel. Worst part was the sagging matresses. Woke up with a terrible backache! The hotel could definitely use some upgrading. Only reason we were there was because we bought on hotwire. Won't do that again!

Reviews.Title: “So you thought you'd get what you paid for did you?”
Reviews.Author: waterweaver
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel for a 3 night stay which I got cheap on the secret hotel option on Travelocity. The secret is I paid too much, not really, I guess it was worth $79, maybe. First was the check-in, a woman who talked entirely too much took almost 20 minutes to check us in to two pre-paid rooms and much to my surprise there is a $7 per night charge to park your car!!! When I asked why I was told it was because they were close to the airport. I was then told the restaurant had been shut down a couple days earlier and there would be only donuts instead of the usual "continental breakfast"....hmmm......do I think of the Health Department??? The beds are clean and the view of the bay is on the 5th and 6th floor maybe NOT on the 4th or below. I noticed they sold the bay view as an extra so thought I'd mention something. The ice maker on the 5th floor was broken and the one by the pool dispensed ice 1 cube at a time, drop on make on drop one make one. Gave me time to look at the pool that changed colors at night and was very cloudy during the day. The room service made the bed. and emptied the trash cans, that's it, no replacement coffee, no replacement wash clothes or towels, the old paper coffee cups were left where they lay. No replacements, I wanted some water so I went looking for an ATM and was told rather sarcastically " we are located right behind a bank" so I walked to the bank for cash, then I had to ask for change, the woman didn't have access to the "drawer" so the older gentleman had to look, of course we were interuping him from his trip to where ever he was so we did have to wait.......ok no change......go to the bar Railey's very loud techno music, very nice bartenders and younger 20's people dressed to the nine's ready to party, they did look like thugs but we didn't feel threatened however I was glad the car was parked in the garage, which by the way had a gate that was closed once and nobody seems to be responsible for opening it, I guess that is why it was only closed once. Overall, it was OK but a constant joke. The halls smell like something I can't put my finger on. The bedding was clean, no bugs. The rooms, not so much, the service, not so much, did I mention after all that trouble the bottle of water was $2 and finally the biggest laugh was the paint job, our room door and the bathroom door were painted a dark maroon, only one coat, kinda like a 4 yr old did it. Cheap, broken and not so clean, I'd prefer the Motel 6 for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience!”
Reviews.Author: baseballguy_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here May 31, 2011. I have out of town guests coming soon and I am taking them to SeaWorld. I booked this hotel because is it close to SeaWorld and reasonable in price. Then I noticed the HORRIBLE reviews on this site. Worried that I would offend my guests next week--I decided to stay here on a business trip--just to check it out. I don't know what people are expecting for under $100, but this hotel was more than adequate for my needs. It's not the Ritz, but it was clean and comforable. NO BEDBUGS NO FIRE ALARMS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT Everything worked fine, showers, Television, refrigerator etc. And the elevators worked just fine. Lobby is upscale for a Choice Hotel. Lobby Staff was efficient Yes--you pay for parking--they have an underground parking garage I stayed on the sixth floor--so did not hear any noises from the bar. If you want Fancy--pay a couple of hundred dollars more and stay elsewhere. At a Quality Inn--you are just going to get a place to sleep. As long as it is clean, don't expect much else. I travel 100 nights per year on business. I am Diamond Choice and Diamond Hilton. I have see pretty much everything when it comes to Hotels. I never do reviews, but the comments here were so "over the top", I felt I should weigh in.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY IN THIS CESS-POOL!”
Reviews.Author: CHW34
Reviews.Content: 1st we drove around for 20 min. to find parking, the front desk shrugged their shoulders when we asked where to park. While in the parking lot, a lower gang looking car pulled through slowly while staring at the other gang member looking guys standing outside the restaurant, which is really a Club/bar. We were pretty scared at that point, when at that time a van with several girls that looked like hookers got out. Really, we have seen more clothes on people at the beach! From the back one girl looked as though she only had on a bottom with ruffles. There were 9-10 in all. The went right through the lobby. After 15 min to check in, watching 5 people leave due to no parking or the condition of the rooms, we got to ours. Rundown does not describe this place! Dirty. We were very close to leaving. I wish we had. We were on the 4th floor and the bass from the Bar/club was rattling up there. They gave us a discount for breakfast in the morning, but there was no way we were eating there! So far no bedbug bites. I wouldn't let my husband turn off all the lites as I was afraid what might come out when it was dark. Horrible, hooker and gang member infested....and who know what else.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised but not by much.”
Reviews.Author: wanderingwen
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed at this hotel by Expedia's "blind hotel by price". At first I was elated by the $72 all in price, I was quickly scared after looking at the reviews. The lowdown: guest services was gruff and hapless. bob grumbled when don gave us a room on the 6th floor with a king bed because of what we paid but after waiting to be served for over 10 minutes, sucks to be bob. room was clean with the exception of the bathroom vent and the actual toilet itself. yes it's true folks, the counter is granite. bed was certified bed bug free from my exterminator husband, my paranoid about bed bugs exterminator husband. sheets and towels were clean and smelled faintly of bleach. the pillows were cheap. shower pressure was decent. the location was 4 miles away from Sea World (one main long street) and super easy to get to. one the 6th floor overlooking the harbor, everything was quiet and the views of the gas lamp and harbor were nice. The Dana this is not but If you looking for a clean, quiet place to sleep that's cheap, this is it. And make sure to have breakfast at At The Point Cafe. Sublime!

Reviews.Title: “SEEDY! This place hasn't, been quality for a long time!”
Reviews.Author: Groll
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days. the elevators creek,doors don,t shut properly. Doors at the end of the building have no locks so are not secured at night. the spa is a joke still only one machine no sauna steam room etc. The key failed to work 1/2 the time. The window on our room did not close completely so we heard whistling all night. thank God we did not have bedbugs but the mattress was very hard. the clock was broken and the firealarm box was hanging off the wall. This is the kind of place you would send someone you really didn't like and wanted to have them suffer!

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel, plenty of nice ones near by.”
Reviews.Author: Toddice09
Reviews.Content: The service at the front desk was slow or unresponsive. My card key needed reset almost every day of my two week stay. I was told it was their machine and they could do anything but reprogram the card each day. The entire building looks like it hasn't had an update or refresh. Looks and feels like you are stepping back into the 70's. The evevators seemed old and run down. The room was large enough and the bed was comfortable. The TV remote didn't work and they tried to fix it but never were able to get it to work. The fire alarm went off for 10-15 seconds every night. I asked at the front desk about it and they said it just happens. They said if it was a real fire it would go off much longer. The washing machine was broken and a few days the vending machine was broken. Only one vending machine on the first floor instead of one per floor. The club on the first floor can be loud. I could hear it in my room at night. The location was great. The hotel is walking distance to many businesses and a great view facing the water. Maides cleaned the rooms very well. They looked spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Situation Still The Same at this Tenement Housing!”
Reviews.Author: GaryHead
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 6th Floor last night across from the ONE working Elevator! Yes...the Fire Alarm STILL goes off at random times during the night. It's a non-smoking Hotel....BUT the Smokers just open the Fire Escape Doors and Smoke on the Balconies....the Smoke fills the hallways. A complaint to front desk yielded nothing. Ran the Room A/C from Noon to check out the next morning....blew a LITTLE cool air but it was cooler outside than it was in the room! Getting around in the morning was IMPOSSIBLE! Kiddies playing in the Elevator and ALL housekeeping staff using it to get their carts around. The "other" Elevator was out of order. This place allows pets.....hope you don't mind Barking Dogs between the false Fire Alarms! :)

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: marinemom69
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read the reviews of this hotel before I stayed. My daughter and I shared a room, and it was ok, I've stayed in worse I guess. But my son's room, he shared a room with my brother, and both of them noticed the bites after we checked out. My son has bites on his shoulders, back and arms, my brother has bites along his waistline and lower back. This is so gross. I emailed the company that manages this hotel but haven't received any word back from them. I must concur with several of the other complaints, as well. The bar is extremely loud, I was on the 6th floor and could hear the bass thumping until early in the morning, the "complimentary" breakfast wasn't worth it, we walked to Denny's, the parking lot was tiny, my other brother's room was being cleaned until after 3pm so he had to hang out in my room, Friday night the fire alarm went off and my daughter, my brother and sister-in-law all had to go outside at 1030 at night until it was cleared, apparently it was a mistake, the shower head was perfect for my 13 year old daughter who stands 5 foot 2, but I had to do back bends to rinse my hair, there was no refrigerator, one of the packets for the coffee had no creamer or sugar...I'm nitpicking now but when you get bit by bedbugs, you tend to focus on the small things! DON'T STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a nice hotel! We liked it!”
Reviews.Author: MariaDelight
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the star rating - it doesn't feel like 2 stars at all. It's much better. Good-looking lobby, nice managers, very CLEAN rooms, complimentary breakfast in the morning. The night club is there, in the left side of the building and we stayed on the 5th floor of the right side so I honestly don't know how noisy it is in other rooms, but our room was completely quiet. Now back to the bathroom - very clean. I was surprised but everything just sparkled. They even have granite counters. The location is cool too - near the beach, right next to Denny's. I mean, don't get me wrong - it's not a 5 star luxury hotel, but simple clean affordable place to stay. I liked it and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good bargain hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amador
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the top (6th) floor, with a window facing the Bay. Thus our room was quiet, day and night. The room was clean and the price was right for a ten day stay in this expensive town. We chose it for price and location (near our family at Liberty Station). Underground parking was a nice touch. Gripes: The light over the bathroom mirror didn't work and could not be fixed. The breakfast is the worst I've encountered in my travels - even the fresh baked waffles came out like rubbery wonder bread. The bar on the first floor does not attract the high society crowd - it is very noisy. The desk staff is often absent, though they are helpful when they are there. I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here! Bed bug alert!”
Reviews.Author: HandsumMuscle
Reviews.Content: I travel the country all the time for work and this has to be one of the worst if not the worst experience I have ever had. The hotel is above a biker bar that plays loud music into the wee hours of the morning. If you like to sleep it ain't gonna happen there. The worst part was getting bitten 20 or more times by bed bugs. The ugly big red welts showed on my body for weeks. I had to check out early. When I called the front desk to tell them the brain dead bimbo couldn't of been more non-plussed. She gave me a Holly go lightly response of "OK", no apology, nothing!! If you enjoy your body having marks on it for weeks and not getting any sleep this is the perfect place for you.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL OF MY LIFE”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaTraveler01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a crew regatta. There were so many problems that I will just list them: 1. drunk men smoking pot in the halls make the entire floor smell. drunk men knocking on teammates doors at 2:30 AM 2. club downstairs with music that kept everyone up until 2AM 3. dirty rooms, with very old furniture- very tacky 4. beds were harder than rocks 5. beds were incredibly small 6. fire alarm was broken in my room 7. phone was broken in multiple rooms 8. wake up calls never came 9. breakfast was mediocre 10. room keys barely worked 11. no hot water in shower 12. no service or help...the front desk did nothing about the pot smokers or drunkeness in the hallways late at night 13. most TV channels were fuzzy 14. this hotel is essentially for drunk drug dealers that are looking for a cheap stay 15. i was sexually harrassed by a drunk person in the hall 16. there was a dog that kept teammates up all night when pets were not allowed 17. the fridge's froze our food 18. some rooms didn't have freezers 19. there was hair on the beds- sheets were dirty 20. one of the ceilings was leaking 21. the shower heads are for people that are 5 foot or shorter 22. this hotel is for one night stands never stay here unless you want to contract a disease 23. the pool was super small 24. the fitness room was 1 machine that didn't work...very unsanitary as well... 25. parking garage was too small...VERY limited parking

Reviews.Title: “The new and better Quality Inn”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock44
Reviews.Content: My most recent stay at this Quality Inn was delightful. The staff were very helpful and understanding to my needs.I've stayed at this location whenever I fly into and out of San Diego because of its closeness to the airport. On this visit I noticed that the hotel had renovations that really enhanced the whole property. The room was clean and comfortable. The value was top notch.I would recommend this hotel to any one in need of a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: koa2010
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, Jayson greeted us, helped with the parking and gave us great info because were celebrating a birthday at the hotel. He was very nice and answered our questions and helped with our family checking in. I look forward staying at the Quality Inn.

Reviews.Title: “quality experience”
Reviews.Author: tripcrazy78
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were very happy that the hotel was very clean and organized, the staff was very proffesional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable stay”
Reviews.Author: liveforvaca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last Saturday on our weekend trip to the San Diego Zoo and Sea World. Since we were with our two god kids, the hotel location was ideal since it was only 10 minutes from Sea World and there were plenty of places to eat right next to it. The hotel itself was just OK. You can tell it was dated since the carpets looked a bit old and the elevator made a lot of noise. The rooms itself was acceptableâ€¦ once we actually got one. We checked in pretty late and perhaps the staff was tired, but they assigned us to a room that was already occupiedâ€¦ twice! The guy working the counter was very apologetic and decided to provide us with free parking for our trouble, which is $7/night, so that was cool. Now as I said, the rooms were acceptable. The dÃ©cor and TV was a bit dated, no flat screen here. But it served its purpose of providing a comfortable place to sleep. Oh, I should mention that my wife and the kids did say that the lounge below played loud music that would wake them but I was knocked out so coudn't comment on that. All in all I would say the place was acceptable for the price since we got it off Priceline. So if your winning bid lands you here, itâ€™s not the end of the world. But if given a choice, I donâ€™t think we will be staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: hmoney
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel off of hotwire.com for $49US/night. Room felt dirty, carpet definately needs cleaning. Felt as if bugs were crawling on us. If you don't like noise, the hotel bar has a band that plays until midnight which you can hear from room. Only good thing, hotel is walking distance to restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Hotel - Safe and Clean for $60/night”
Reviews.Author: SteakSnob
Reviews.Content: Quality Inn by Choice Hotels can be hit and miss in terms of the quality of the property. This hotel property, located right by the naval station and close to the airport is a good location if you want to be on the north side of Mission Bay. This is definitely a no frills hotel - properly is quite dated and the room doors open to the outside. Bathroom was clean and the towels were thin. Internet was free as well as breakfast. Nothing to jump up and down about but the hotel is a good value for $60 a night. Would recommend for business people just needing a night's rest and moving on. May not be ideal for a week's stay.

Reviews.Title: “I would NEVER recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: katybetht
Reviews.Content: Nothing about this hotel was up to par. We had mold in the bathroom. What they dont tell you is that there is a karaoke bar in the hotel that they say they have no control over. We were on the TOP floor on the complete opposite end of the hotel and COULDN'T sleep any of the nights. The majority of the staff was rude and they did not care at all about your complaints. They also claim to have free WI-FI but we were unable to access it during our stay. When we would ask the staff how to get connected to it they couldnt help. They also charge nightly for parking which it doesn't tell you on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Count your teeth”
Reviews.Author: howellpix
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a year ago for our last night because they had free airport shuttle. No more. When we checked in, they wouldn't credit my Choice Privileges card because I booked through another internet site. We had to drop off our rental car and asked if they could pick us up at the airport. We were told it would be $7 each way and you had to pay in advance. We paid in cash and didn't get a receipt. I asked if we needed a ticket for the morning, and he said it wasn't necessary. The desk clerk ended up waiving the second $7 fee for going to the airport the next morning. He said he put it on the computer (we watched him) so that staff would know, and to be out front 5 minutes before the 11 a.m. shuttle. When we came down in the morning, staff claimed we weren't booked, so we explained, and finally got on. They were also telling the morning guests that the charge was $10 !!! and had people very upset. These were people who had stayed there before and the service was free. Between 10 and 11 p.m. they were running loud vacuum cleaners in room above us. We were trying to sleep as we had had a long drive before arriving, and would have a long travel day ahead, flying to the East coast. The room itself was fine for one night. They now charge $3 to use the lobby computer, which also had been free. The so-called breakfast was luke-warm coffee and junk food, but we had a good breakfast at close by Denny's. The staff is now hasseling me by long distance phone calls about the airport shuttle. With a tough economy, these folks don't seem to realize they are alienating formerly loyal customers who will now never return. My advice would be to check carefully for airport shuttle service, parking, internet use FEES before you choose. My guess is, this place will fold because they don't understand service or consider the needs of guests.

Reviews.Title: “In big need of modernising.”
Reviews.Author: smessie1
Reviews.Content: The staff where friendly & the parking free & safe but the hotel its self was terrible. The rooms where small and damp as our window didn't close properly. The location was on a busy road which meant it was noisy at night. Over all it was a very dated hoteel & I wouldn't stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Ants in the room”
Reviews.Author: Bengel
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire. Because of this, Quality Inn's 100% satisfaction guarantee did not apply to our stay. Our first room had ants. We wondered how they came to be in a third floor room. The staff offered to spray the room. We declined, not wanting insecticide permeating the room while we slept. The next day staff accepted our belongings and stored them until a new room was ready. We spent the day playing tourist. When we returned, our belongings were in our new room. No ants, but the refrigerator doesn't work. The continental breakfast was basic, muffins, bagels, and some cold cereal with milk. Orange juice and apple juice were also provided, and some fresh fruit. The staff were courteous, and apologetic when we made them aware of the problem in our room. Would we stay here again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Good for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: wskigrl
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews of this hotel i was worried... but none of what they wrote was true for my family. The staff was very helpful, the room was nice, ( it is an ecomony hotel ) the linnens were new, close to everything we went to, it is only 2 miles from sea world. La Jolla is very close. I would recomend to a family wanting to take in the attractions in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “If it had a good a/c it would have been much better.”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad24
Reviews.Content: For the price of the rooms I expected more. The lobby was very nice. You do have to pay to park which i think should be included in the hotel rate though. It was very clean, my son crawled around and never got dirty, there was a lot of fancy stuff as far as the towels and shampoo and all. But, the room I was in was HOT, the air conditioner did not work, I told them about it and they supposedly sent someone up to fix it while i was gone the 2nd day but it was still hot that afternoon i told them about it again and they said it had been fixed and kinda acted like i was just making up stuff. They wouldn't change my rooms so I'd wake up sweating. The cable kept going out for some reason which i guess is actually the cable company but it was irritating.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: hotelguestfelix
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location if ur coming to do everything we did. San Deigo Zoo, Gaslamp Quarter, Old Town San Diego, Sea World, and Tijuana. We did all 5 things, and were conveniently located to all of them! Great customer service, comfy room, with nice bedding, and a huge window, with a view of the marina, reasonable price, reasonable breakfast, quiet hotel, underground covered parking was nice, and the hotel itself was pretty well decorated. In-hosue bar was comfortable and casual, and even allowed us to take our drinks to our room, though in plastic cups. Internet access in lobby was nice, front desk staff was great with directions, housekeeping staff was friendly, and took are of our needs fantastically! in-room safe for our cameras and cash and stuff. Great room.

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand what everyone has against this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: boipuppy
Reviews.Content: Don't know what everyone is complaining about. My room had no mould, no awful smells, I was not bitten by anything in the bed- which was also comfortable, carpet was nice and clean, the staff were helpful and the elevators worked just fine. OK the pool looked like it needed cleaning, but in the middle of November it could have very well been closed anyway (I didn't check). At 89 dollars per night I couldn't ask for more. This isn't a five star hotel by anymeans (nor do they claim it to be), but nor is it the slum that people are making it out to be.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone please contact Better Business Bureau on these guys”
Reviews.Author: brenandjace
Reviews.Content: I have written a previous review, but I also contact the Better Business Bureau and found not one complaint on these guys. It occurs to me if enough of us contact them, they have to do something to take these guys out of business. Please take a moment and contact www.BBB.com and let them do the fighting for us.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: futbolfreek
Reviews.Content: I sent an employee here during a conference. Hotel was supposed to send fax form for credit card. They never sent it, so they wouldn't let my employee check in first night when they didn't have my credit card info. Manager was extremely rude during the process of trying to fix the situation, which involved giving my employee a hard time as well as myself. After finally checking in, first night was interrupted by vacuuming at 2AM. Should never have gone there- never will again.

Reviews.Title: “Completely and utterly disgusting!!!”
Reviews.Author: heavenlyval
Reviews.Content: After looking at the pictures on the website we were expecting sooooo much better!!! This was the first family vacation with all 7 of us and I thought I was just going to break down and cry the moment we walked in! When we first walked in the rooms where so hot you immediately started sweating and smelly. The TV in the living room was gone and they did not know when it was going to be replaced. I will list the Pros and Cons for this place: Pros -close to Sea World and downtown / Zoo -Large rooms for a family of 7 -Quiet (for being next to the elevator) -Pretty comfortable beds -did not see any bugs like the other reviews Cons - AC did not cool the rooms even after being on for 4 hours (on high) straight, had to call the front office and get 2 fans so that we could sleep in there. Had to put my makeup on in the car because the room was to hot and all you would was sweat. - No fan in the bathroom / very humid and the bath tub filled up when you took a shower and would take an hour to drain. -Stunk very badly (like a huge wet dog) and the carpet was always wet around the bathroom which made the smell even worse -$225.00 a night for 3 nights (was a complete waste of money) -Could never use the pool because of the time they close it (9pm) -Was not a clean room when we walked in and things stuck to the end tables and you had to rip them off, destroying whatever it was -the windows did not open so you could not get any fresh air -the parking garge was horrible and you had to pay 5.00 a day, which they did not tell us until we checked out. I could not figure out why they charged for parking, it is not like there is a lot of things around there and they were trying to keep the garge for hotel guests only and there was no security down there. And there were low hanging pipes all over the garge and there were a couple that we almost hit with our mini van as the hung down so low. -It would take years of renovations before this hotel would be up to code. -refrig. did not work -nasty and horrible furniture -no door on the bedroom leading to the living room, had to change in the corner of the room where our 5 boys could not see me (no privacy at all ) -only 1 bathroom for 7 people, had to go to the lobby to use the bathroom if someone else was using the room bathroom -no one asked us how our stay was when we check out or I would have given them and ear full. Just wanted to get out of there. We really should have left and went to another hotel!!!!!!!!!!! -Was not comfortable to come back to after being at the zoo and Seaworld for 14 hours. -Curtains had holes and cut marks in them -Carpet was wet around the AC unit and it looked like it was going to fall out of the wall. -Very few cable channels -had to share the tv with the kids because the other room was missing one Overall, this hotel is not worth any money and I would never stay here again no matter how much they fixed it up. I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. This place really does need to be shut down and I might look into trying to get my money back ($764.00) based off of false advertising on their website. Nothing like their pictures and description and they never once told us are stated on their website that they were renovating. We tried to stay out of the room as much as possible! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “SHOULD BE CONDEMNED!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There should not even be a circle colored in! Terrible is too nice of a word! After viewing the lovely photos on their website, I booked our family a 5 day stay in a 2 room suite at this hotel. I began to feel leery when I drove up to the hotel, and saw a mix of the tower of terror and Bates Motel. Dad checked us in and we began our descent into the bowels. After nearly shattering the back window of our hatcback on the low hanging sprinkler system, we approached the gaping black abyss of an open elevator shaft. We cautiously entered the foul smelling small dark box of the working elevator, and slowly arrived at our floor. The smell was nauseating. Our feet squished through the soggy carpet. Our hotel door looked as if a wild animal had clawed at it for at least several hours. The wet carpet continued throughout the room and their was moisture discoloration halfway up the walls. Their was mold along the ceiling, dead bugs were "sleeping" on the couches, the "dining room" furniture were mismatched Salvation Army rejects that apperared to be in the same condition as the door, scratched up, gnawed on and unstable. There were exposed an low hanging pipes throughout the room. The bathroom was a sandy, moldy, mess that we refused to enter. All bathroom fixtures were rusted, and there were no towels or washcloths. The television set was a 1970 relic, with permanent sticky moisture rings. out of courisity, we opened the dresser drawers and discovered hundreds of dead bugs stuck in sticky red syrup. We promptly returned to the front desk and received a refund, with NO QUESTIONS ASKED. After this horrifying incident, we no longer stay in choice hotels, and I am no longer allowed to book hotels for our family vacations.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After getting stuck in San Diego due to fog, our trip went from bad to worse after staying at this hotel. Room was very smelly and there were stains on the floor in the restroom. I was charged on my credit card for the stay even though we paid with traveler checks and it is going on day 6 and the charges have not been reversed. The "person" I need to speak with is never available..I am so frustrated! I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Customer is Wrong”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worst experience this year, or in recent memory. Terrible front desk staff, poor rooms for the price. Stay at any of the 6 hotels that are a stones throw from it, they are the same price and all much nicer! One night is too many there.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again, nor would I recommend this place!”
Reviews.Author: islandb8by
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, $72 each night. I overheard a man checking in and he was paying $160 a night at the same hotel. Pays to book early. However, I would not pay $72 a night for a hotel in this condition. Pros- -AC worked fine -bed was somewhat comfortable -lights all worked fine Cons- -Broken TV (no volume) -parking garage (that you have to pay $5/day) was not in the best shape- looked very creepy -towels were very rough -signs everywhere saying "we're in the middle of renovating" however it looked like someone just ripped out the baseboards, spackled the walls, and did nothing else -room # signs were missing, so someone just wrote the room # on some of the doors -jacuzzi was out of service -went to front desk at 8pm to ask for an extra pillow- front desk staff was rude and said housekeeping was closed for the night and he was unable to get anything for us -paint bubbling off of ceiling in bathroom -no fan in bathroom= very humid and wet environment asking for mold to grow! -slow elevator Overall, I would NOT stay at this place again. They need to shut the hotel down, completely renovate it, and then reopen it in order to get some decent reviews.

Reviews.Title: “stay away from this so called "quality inn" hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4th of july wkend, we wanted to go cheap so we picked this 1-1/2 star hotel. BAD IDEA!!! #1. the room smelled bad like sewer, we had to get a plug in air freshener so we could stay in there for 3 nights. #2. the frontdesk people were not courteous and they gave us bad driving directions when we wanted to go to coronado island. #3. they dont serve breakfast on weekdays and did not inform us beforehand. #4. small bathroom, bathroom door when opened is about 3 inches away from the toilet #5. for the complimentary continental breakfast (w/c i repeat they ONLY serve ON WEEKENDS) they only have cereals, white bread, danish, pastries, apple juice, milk and coffee... that's it, no bagels or oatmeal #6. parking is too tight #7. when in the elevator, the whole thing shakes. #8. no refrigerator or microwave in the room. the only POSITIVE THING i can say about the hotel is the LOCATION. it's right across denny's, kfc, mcdonalds, 4 miles away seaworld, gaslamp, 6 miles away from sd zoo/balboa park, 10 miles from coronado island (yeah only 10 miles if the frontdesk gives u good directions)

Reviews.Title: “Low Quality Inn”
Reviews.Author: seudjif
Reviews.Content: My one major complaint throughout my stay was a sewer water-like stench coming from the bathroom. The water was shut off throughout the building for about an hour at one point. I'm sure it was for maintenance issues but why take the chance. The whole place just looks unmaintained. Daily servicing of the room was good. There is a $5 a day parking fee. The parking lot is very small, so finding parking on the hotel lot is not garanteed. Would have dished out a little more $$ for a little for quality.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you like... sewer smelling water! :)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Welcome to the Quality Inn, where youâ€™ll find flickering lights, creepy elevators, not enough parking and sewer smelling water. Every time I turned on the water a sewer smell came out from under the sink. I asked maintenance could look at it, but nothing happened. Parking was difficult to find on the weekend after 9pm, not to mention a $5 parking fee. There was some mold on the crevices of the window. Looking out the window you will see A Holiday Inn and Best Western. After 3 nights of staying at the Quality Inn, either hotel was looking like 4 star quality. Spend the extra $20 a night and save yourself some despair and stay elsewhere. Ok, there is a few good things about this hotel... its close to Starbucks, Old Town and the freeway, and the front desk people were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We paid around $40 per night for our stay here. Our room was clean, we had a view of downtown San Diego and part of the harbor. The parking garage is poorly laid out but safe. Other than the poor condition of the elevator (namely it was very slow), I definitely recommend this hotel. I'm not sure where all the bad reviews are coming from.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Shuttle Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am amazed at the bad reviews for this hotel, and wonder whether they describe the same place? We stayed there for 5 nights in March 2004, and again in December 2004. It is an older hotel, but it has been newly renovated with care and our room was always clean and fresh and comfortable. It is in a much quieter location than I would expect in a big city (we could leave our window open at night), and the rooms on the harbor side have a nice view of the city skyline. Their shuttle service is absolutely wonderful. They serve both Amtrak and the airport, and they happily delivered us to the cruise ship dock. In fact, in order to accommodate us and the many other cruise ship passengers staying with them, they put a second shuttle into service. There is a bus stop 1/2 block away. We were able to take busses to SeaWorld and the San Diego Zoo, and also to Old Town and the downtown area. There are several restaurants and fast food places within walking distance, as well as a restaurant in the hotel, and there is a large super market on the corner. It would be hard to beat this hotel for comfort and convenience, and for the friendly attitude of management.

Reviews.Title: “Its not the Hilton, but enough for one nights rest”
Reviews.Author: Seasoned-Traveler88
Reviews.Content: Paid under $40.00USD on the net booking, it was a safe, reasonable place to stay. Pool and jacuzzi were ok. Airport pickup = 10 min wait.must call at baggage claim for pick up neighborhood not the greatest, but I had no problems. supermarket across the street also McDonalds, Arbys. bed was comfortable and view was quite nice. Tuesday night was quiet, no outside disturbing noise. Free pastry and coffee 7am til 10am. eastside of building has nicest view. 25 "TV all rooms and simple desk.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL IN THE WORLD!!!”
Reviews.Author: Neil17
Reviews.Content: Cost me $170 to stay in a run down smelly hell hole! And they even had the cheek to charge me $5 for parking!! I'm still trying to get my money back, they should've paid me to stop there. I'm not gonna stop pestering them until I get a full refund. PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Quality has set a new low!”
Reviews.Author: gstabc
Reviews.Content: I was desperate. I booked a weekend trip the day before I left on Aug. 12. This was done through a AAA rep. In its day this hotel must have been very nice. However now it's one step away from a welfare hotel. They do charge for underground parking which appeared to be relatively safe and convenient. But I would not allow my wife to roam around there or on the premises alone. I told the hotel clerk that the $5.00 parking fee was not listed as part of the AAA and she gave me a permit w/o charge. The room was fair-I expected worse but it was livable for the two nights we were there. As was mentioned before this is not a quality hotel unless your sense of qulaity has set a new low. The hotel was cheaper than all the other hotels around but never pay MORE THAN $90.00 a night to stay here. It is not worth it. I rated it 2 "stars" only because I survived the experience without scars, germs, etc.

Reviews.Title: “WILL NEVER STAY AT A QUALITY INN AGAIN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience we have ever had. For Approx. $150.00 per night this is what we got. 1. A room that the a/c unit barely worked. 2. A non-smoking room that reeked of cigarette smoke. 3. A bed that the mattress appeared to have been soiled by either someone vomiting or having bowel trouble. We did not discover this until the next morning after sleeping in the bed that night. 4. The room was filthy. My wife would not even shower due to the unsanitary conditions of the room and bathroom. 5. There was evidence that someone had vomited on the carpet and had attempted to clean it up. 6. The bathroom sink fixture handle came off in my hand when I tried to turn the water on. 7. The clerk we checked out with was very nice, he was an older more seasoned clerk, but I had to tell the younger male clerk, who keep interupting in a very rude manner, to shut up and mind his own business as the nice clerk was noting our complaints on a form. I should have taken names, but I didn't. I think the younger, rude clerk was looking for a reason to delay his next customer because she was a lot more upset than I was and she was just waiting her turn. (After talking to her I can see why). 8. We only had 2 bath towels, no wash cloths or hand towels. (We learned long ago to always bring a wash cloth with us). 9. The elevator was a challenge. You were never quite sure you were going to get to your floor or not. At least this was fixed that day.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience I Had”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This stay was the worst hotel experience I had. Problems: 1. Free Parking was advertised on the website. When we checked in, the staff informed us that $5 parking will be charged per night. When we told the staff that the website states Free Parking, he said that this hotel is not owned by Choice but operates under Franchise. 2. We were given room 520. AC was broken. Room was changed to 518 after telling us that they will install a new AC as we unpacked. We threatened to walk out and then they changed the room? 3. Telephone was broken on room 518. No new room was offered for 2 nights. The telephone was not repaired for the entire stay of 3 nights. No compensation was offered. On the third day, we were offered another room. I declined to move because I was sure that something else will be broken in that room 4. On the Second day, a hotel staff (house man) walked in the room without knocking at 7 am in the morning. Fortunately I was awake so I shouted at him to stay out. From 7 to 8 am, 3 more staff disturbed us by asking if we are checking out that day. We had checked in for 3 days. Why would we want to check out the second day? Oh yes, they also deactivated our keys on the second day, so we were all locked out!! 5. The corriders on 5th floor and elevator had the most obnoxious smell on the first 2 nights. My wife almost gagged on the smell the first night. On the second night, we mastered the art of holding our breath in the elevator. 6. The hotel staff did not inform us the breakfast is complimentary. Other guests also checked in in front of us and they were not informed. 7. On the third day of our stay we asked to see the manager. The manager was in the room behind the counter but he did not see us. During our entire stay, we had so many problems, but he did not even once talked to us or apologized. We were told that the manager will get back to us regarding out complain. Its been 3 days since we checked out, but we have NOT received any communication from the manager or from the hotel. the staff at the counter was rude and had no training at customer service. 8. There was only two ice machines on the first floor. They also needed repair. I had to stand 5 minutes holding the button just to fill half of my ice bucket. 9. The pool and the jacuzi had no lights in the night. There were no towels near the pool. There were just 2 pillows and 2 towels in the room

Reviews.Title: “place needs some work”
Reviews.Author: Brookline30something
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here in December 2003 while attending a convention. The bedroom was clean. The bathroom appeared old but was clean overall. However, the facility probably could use some renovation. The elevator looked kind of shabby; e.g. the tiles were cracked. The lobby area was poorly lit and did not look like it was maintained well. I actually expected the place to be in better shape given that it was "Quality Inn."

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn Airport SeaWorld Area
HotelInfo.Address: 2901 Nimitz Blvd, San Diego, CA 92106
